attributes.action: Take Ian Duncan Smith to court for human rights abuses
attributes.background:
We the people of the United Kingdom want to see Ian Duncan Smith (Work and Pensions secretary)
tried at Court Level for crimes against humanity regarding the past five years Human Rights abuses via the harsh regime administered by the Department of Work

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament do not have the power to take a Minister to court for human rights abuses. 

If you would like the UK Government or Parliament to investigate or launch a public inquiry on the human rights implications of specific DWP policies, we could accept a petition on that. Alternatively, if you would like a specific law or policy relating to the work of the DWP to be changed, we could also accept a petition on that.
